TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> Break stuff? What kind of stuff? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

The accounts of people who ask too many questions ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
That,and little sections of the forum with certain tags. They also break those.

> 
> Break stuff? What kind of stuff? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Its easier than you think to break things in admin control panel. (I'm an admin on another forum)

Like yesterday, while trying to get the forum to auto-prune spambots, I nearly kicked the founder of the project off the forum. ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-28T20:45:39Z" title="08/28/2015 08:45  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 28, 2015</time> by Endersmens**

> 
> Its easier than you think to break things in admin control panel. (I'm an admin on another forum)
> Like yesterday, while trying to get the forum to auto-prune spambots, I nearly kicked the founded of the project off the forum. ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif)

Yeah, as admin of the War of Insanity forum I can also attest to the "easier than it looks" fact.

"What's this button do?" *Breaks forum header*

Note to self, study HTML before you go and mess with it. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Yeah, as admin of the War of Insanity forum I can also attest to the "easier than it looks" fact.
> "What's this button do?" *Breaks forum header*
> 
> Note to self, study HTML before you go and mess with it. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I think i should give you some rep for that statement. Moderation in itself is harder than it looks!

> 
> Its easier than you think to break things in admin control panel. (I'm an admin on another forum)
> Like yesterday, while trying to get the forum to auto-prune spambots, I nearly kicked the founded of the project off the forum. ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif)

I guess I'll never be an admin. I couldn't resist pressing everything. For science!

> 
> That,and little sections of the forum with certain tags. They also break those.

We have to keep the forumites on their toes as well. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

What's the background color of the bit with your avatar? (If you wanted to make "transparent" avatars, for example)

I'm very close but just a tad off.

> 
> What's the background color of the bit with your avatar? (If you wanted to make "transparent" avatars, for example)
> I'm very close but just a tad off.

Make a PNG with transparency?

Or does that not work?

> 
> Make a PNG with transparency?
> Or does that not work?

Not for me, no, it just defaults to a white background.

Right now I think the background is probably #f4f4f4 (The sidebar, the text window is #fafafa)
On my avatar it is F2F6F8.

> 
> On my avatar it is F2F6F8.

Yep, looks like that's done it. Thanks! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Yop, this bug me since a few week: ability to re-rate a thread (you own previous rating replacement) ... was thinking about that for a few thread i rated lately just to modify my own vote by one usually after thinking / brainstorming : rethought about the things / reading what's everyone say.
I'm trying to post an update to my mission report, every time I try to go advanced on the reply it says the token has expired.

> 
> I'm trying to post an update to my mission report, every time I try to go advanced on the reply it says the token has expired.

Hmmm, this may be a browser cache thing, please clear your browser cache and try again.

> 
> I'm trying to post an update to my mission report, every time I try to go advanced on the reply it says the token has expired.

Also, are you doing a really long write or edit? if you take too long your login will expire due to lack of activity.
can closed threads be 'opened' again? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Have there been any incidents where a moderator or admin has accidentally broken the forum or messed something up in a massive way? 

As an example of the sort of thing I mean, a wikipedia moderator once deleted the main page after another moderator jokingly told him it was impossible - he didn't realise it was a joke.

> 
> can closed threads be 'opened' again? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Yes.

> 
> Have there been any incidents where a moderator or admin has accidentally broken the forum or messed something up in a massive way? 
> As an example of the sort of thing I mean, a wikipedia moderator once deleted the main page after another moderator jokingly told him it was impossible - he didn't realise it was a joke.

Ask Red Iron Crown.
Do moderators sometimes disagree about the closing of a thread? How often does this occur?

> 
> Ask Red Iron Crown.

? I have not broken the forum to my knowledge since becoming a moderator. I've had some minor snafus, like accidentally moving things to the wrong place and such, but nothing that broke anything.

> 
> Do moderators sometimes disagree about the closing of a thread? How often does this occur?

Rarely. Since becoming a mod last January I can only recall one time where a thread was locked and then later reopened (no specifics on this one, sorry).

> 
> Have there been any incidents where a moderator or admin has accidentally broken the forum or messed something up in a massive way? 
> As an example of the sort of thing I mean, a wikipedia moderator once deleted the main page after another moderator jokingly told him it was impossible - he didn't realise it was a joke.

A certain fool may have been doing naughty things with html in messages at one point. Just to demonstrate the silliness of allowing html in messages.

This resulted in a hasty patch by someone else to block all 

tags. Because 

> 
> along with all kinds of other bbcode elements get converted into a 
> in vbulletin, this... broke the forums. Quite badly, for about five minutes until the mistake was realised.
> And let's not get into the Great Purge of 2013.
How,are people able to post youtube videos directly onto their threads or onto,threads in general? All i get are URLs!

> 
> How,are people able to post youtube videos directly onto their threads or onto,threads in general? All i get are URLs!

[noparse]

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WXzMDkKhO5g?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
 [/noparse]
does this:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WXzMDkKhO5g?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

And to get the above code to show up in the forum, you do:

[noparse][noparse]

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WXzMDkKhO5g?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
 [/noparse][/noparse]
And finally, you can tell how anybody does anything in their posts by clicking the "quote" button and looking at the code.

/notamod
I just joined the wiki! Is my obsessive adding of links to the Kerbal Astronomical Society okay? Thanks!
